How to set up Jekyll

Jekyll is a static site generator. You can install it on your Windows or Linux pc or MacOS. It might seem tricky at first, but Iâ€™ll tell you exactly what to do.

Prerequisites

Before you install Jekyll you have to make sure that some tools are already installed on your pc. To do that, you need to open the shell (Terminal) and then follow the instructions you can find on this page.

If something is missing, you can download and install it from:

  • Ruby
  • RubyGems
  • GCC
  • Make

Install Jekyll

When you have everything you need, you may proceed with the installation of Jekyll and bundler gems.

Write on your terminal:

Now, you can download and install Lilium Digital Garden and start your first Jekyll site using this template.
